titleStmt.title: Bridge Phase 2: Witness fMS, Collation unit C11

body.ab: <lb n="c56-0057__Pt2__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c56-0057.02" unit="tei:head"/>Ch V– 113<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0057__Pt2__main__2"/> He then put the following letter <lb n="c56-0057__Pt2__main__3"/> into my hands. <lb n="c56-0057__Pt2__main__4"/> "To V. Frankenstien <lb n="c56-0057__Pt2__main__5"/> Geneva <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0057__Pt2__main__d2e11934"/>Apri<del eID="c56-0057__Pt2__main__d2e11934"/><mdel>l</mdel>March 18<shi rend="underline"></shi> 17— <lb n="c56-0057__Pt2__main__6"/> "My dear Cousin<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0057__Pt2__main__7"/> "I cannot describe to you the uneasi<lb n="c56-0058__main__1"/>ness we have all felt concerning your <lb n="c56-0058__main__2"/> health. We cannot help imagining that <lb n="c56-0058__main__3"/> your friend Clerval conceals the ex<lb n="c56-0058__main__4"/>tent of your disorder, for it is now <lb n="c56-0058__main__5"/> several months since we have seen <lb n="c56-0058__main__6"/> your handwriting and all this time <lb n="c56-0058__main__7"/> you have been obliged to dictate to <lb n="c56-0058__main__8"/> Henry – Surely Victor you must have <lb n="c56-0058__main__9"/> been very illand this makes us very wretched as much so <metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0058.01">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0058__left_margin__1"/> nearly as <mdel>t</mdel><lb n="c56-0058__left_margin__2"/> after the death <lb n="c56-0058__left_margin__3"/> of your dear <lb n="c56-0058__left_margin__4"/> mother. My father was almost <lb n="c56-0058__main__10"/> persuaded <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12028"/>of this<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12028"/>that you were indeed dangerously ill, and could hardly <lb n="c56-0058__main__11"/>be re<mdel>f</mdel>strained from <metamark function="insert">߶</metamark>undertaking a journey to Ingolstadt. <lb n="c56-0058__main__12"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12067"/>I<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12067"/><del next="#c56-0058.02" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12071"/>but I entreated him not<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12071"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12074"/>to undertake it<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12074"/><del next="#c56-0058.03" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12080" xml:id="c56-0058.02"/>because<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12080"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12091"/>for<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12091"/><lb n="c56-0058__main__13"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12100" xml:id="c56-0058.03"/>although<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12100"/>his health is better now <lb n="c56-0058__main__14"/> tha<mdel>t</mdel>n it has been since the death <lb n="c56-0058__main__15"/> of My beloved Aunt, yet <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12121"/>tha<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12121"/>the fatigue <lb n="c56-0058__main__16"/> might have<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12136"/>make him very ill<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12136"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12139"/>and<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12139"/><lb n="c56-0058__main__17"/> Clerval always wr<mdel>o</mdel>ites that you <lb n="c56-0058__main__18"/> were getting better <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12161"/>and<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12161"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><mdel>I</mdel>I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12175"/>arden<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12175"/> eagerly hope you <lb n="c56-0058__main__19"/> will confirm thisintelligence soon in your own <lb n="c56-0058__main__20"/> handwriting for indeed, indeed Victor <lb n="c56-0058__main__21"/> we are all very <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12192"/>uneasy<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12192"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>miserable on this account. Relieve <lb n="c56-0058__main__22"/> us from this fear and we shall <lb n="c56-0058__main__23"/> be the happiest creatures in the <lb n="c56-0058__main__24"/> world.– My uncles health <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12211"/>impro<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12211"/> is <lb n="c56-0058__main__25"/> now <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12219"/>well &<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12219"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12222"/>far<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12222"/> vigorous that he appears <lb n="c56-0058__main__26"/> ten years younger since last <lb n="c56-0058__main__27"/> winter. Ernest also is so much im<lb n="c56-0058__main__28"/>proved, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12243"/>so<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12243"/> that you would hardly <lb n="c56-0058__main__29"/> know him; he is now nearly sixteen <lb n="c56-0058__main__30"/> you know and has <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0058__main__d2e12253"/>quite<del eID="c56-0058__main__d2e12253"/> lost that<lb n="c56-0059__main__1"/> sickly appearance that he had <lb n="c56-0059__main__2"/> some years ago – he is quite well &<shi rend="underline">hearty</shi><lb n="c56-0059__main__3"/> if I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12273"/>y<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12273"/> may use that term for it is <lb n="c56-0059__main__4"/> very expressive.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0059__main__5"/> "My uncle and I conversed <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12283"/>the<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12283"/><lb n="c56-0059__main__6"/> last night a long time about what <lb n="c56-0059__main__7"/><lb n="c56-0059__left_margin__1"/> professionErnest <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12303"/><shi rend="underline">should be</shi><del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12303"/>should follow. His constant <lb n="c56-0059__main__8"/> ill health when young has deprived <lb n="c56-0059__main__9"/><lb n="c56-0059__left_margin__1"/> himof the habit of application and now <lb n="c56-0059__main__10"/> that he enjoys good health <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12330"/>we<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12330"/> he <lb n="c56-0059__main__11"/> is continually in the open air <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12335"/>on<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12335"/><lb n="c56-0059__main__12"/> climbing the hills or rowing on the <lb n="c56-0059__main__13"/> lake. I, therefore, proposed that <lb n="c56-0059__main__14"/> he shouldbe a farmer which you <lb n="c56-0059__main__15"/> know cousin is a favourite scheme <lb n="c56-0059__main__16"/> of mine –A farmer's is a very healthy <lb n="c56-0059__main__17"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12355"/>&<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12355"/> happy life; and the least hurtful <lb n="c56-0059__main__18"/> or rather the most benificial <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12360"/>of any<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12360"/><lb n="c56-0059__main__19"/> profession.<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>of any. My <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12377"/>father<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12377"/> uncle had an <lb n="c56-0059__main__20"/> idea of his being<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>educated as an advocate, <mdel>&</mdel>that through <lb n="c56-0059__main__21"/> his interresthe might become a judge. But besides that <lb n="c56-0059__main__22"/> he is not at all fit for such an <lb n="c56-0059__main__23"/> occupation, it is certainly <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12416"/>better<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12416"/>more <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12421"/>honourable<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12421"/>creditable to <lb n="c56-0059__main__24"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12431"/>to<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12431"/> cultivate the earth for the suste<lb n="c56-0059__main__25"/>nance of man than <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12441"/>it<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12441"/> to be the <lb n="c56-0059__main__26"/> confid<mdel/>ant & sometimes <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12459"/>a helpmate<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12459"/>the accomplice of <lb n="c56-0059__main__27"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12471"/>their<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12471"/>his vices; which is the employment<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0059.03">^</metamark><lb n="c56-0059__left_margin__1"/>&<lb n="c56-0059__main__28"/> of a Lawyer. And if he should become <lb n="c56-0059__main__29"/> a judge I said that <mdel>a</mdel><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0059__main__d2e12511"/>rich<del eID="c56-0059__main__d2e12511"/>the occupation of a prosperous farmer <lb n="c56-0059__main__30"/> if it were not a more honourable<lb n="c56-0060__main__1"/> it was at least a happier employ <lb n="c56-0060__main__2"/> ment than that of a judge, whose <lb n="c56-0060__main__3"/> misfortune it was always to meddle <lb n="c56-0060__main__4"/> with the dark side of human nature <lb n="c56-0060__main__5"/> My uncle smiled and said that I <lb n="c56-0060__main__6"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__main__d2e12541"/>ougt<del eID="c56-0060__main__d2e12541"/> ought to be an advocate myself; <lb n="c56-0060__main__7"/> which put an end to the conversation <lb n="c56-0060__main__8"/> on that subject<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0060__main__9"/> And now I must tell you a little <lb n="c56-0060__main__10"/> story that will please you. Do you <lb n="c56-0060__main__11"/> not remember <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__main__d2e12560"/>Ju<del eID="c56-0060__main__d2e12560"/> Justine <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__main__d2e12563"/>Martin<del eID="c56-0060__main__d2e12563"/>?<lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__1"/>Moritz?<lb n="c56-0060__main__12"/> Perhaps you do not I will therefore <lb n="c56-0060__main__13"/> tell you her story in a few words. Mad. <lb n="c56-0060__main__14"/> Martin her Mother was a widow with <lb n="c56-0060__main__15"/> four children of whom <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__main__d2e12584"/>this<del eID="c56-0060__main__d2e12584"/> Justine <lb n="c56-0060__main__16"/> was the third. This girl had always been <lb n="c56-0060__main__17"/> the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__main__d2e12592"/>favou<del eID="c56-0060__main__d2e12592"/> favourite of her father <lb n="c56-0060__main__18"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__main__d2e12599"/>and<del eID="c56-0060__main__d2e12599"/><lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__1"/>but<mdel>by</mdel>thro an odd perversity her Mother <lb n="c56-0060__main__19"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__main__d2e12620"/>never<del eID="c56-0060__main__d2e12620"/> could <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__main__d2e12626"/>bear<del eID="c56-0060__main__d2e12626"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>not endure her and after the <lb n="c56-0060__main__20"/> death of M. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__main__d2e12643"/>Martin<del eID="c56-0060__main__d2e12643"/>Moritz treated her very ill. <lb n="c56-0060__main__21"/> My aunt observed this, and when Justine <lb n="c56-0060__main__22"/> was <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__main__d2e12654"/>ten<del eID="c56-0060__main__d2e12654"/> twelve years old too prevailed <lb n="c56-0060__main__23"/> on her mother to allow her to live <lb n="c56-0060__main__24"/> at our house.<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0060.03">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__1"/><metamark function="displacement">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__2"/> The republican <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__3"/> institutions of our <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__4"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__left_margin__d2e12686"/>state<del eID="c56-0060__left_margin__d2e12686"/> country, have <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__5"/> produced simpler <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__6"/>& happier manners <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__7"/> than those which <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__8"/> prevail in the <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__9"/> great monarchies <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__10"/> that surround it. <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__11"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__left_margin__d2e12704"/>Ju Whilst<del eID="c56-0060__left_margin__d2e12704"/><lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__12"/> Hence there <lb n="c56-0060__left_margin__13"/> is less dis tinction<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__left_margin__d2e12722"/>s<del eID="c56-0060__left_margin__d2e12722"/> between the classes into which human beings have been divided, & the lower orders being neither so poor nor so despised are more refined & moral. A servant at Geneva does not mean the same thing as a servant in France or England —Justine <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__left_margin__d2e12764"/><shi rend="underline">was</shi><del eID="c56-0060__left_margin__d2e12764"/> thus recieved into our family to learn the duties of a servant, which in our fortunate country does not include a sacrifize of the dignity of a human being.<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__main__d2e12806"/>Where<del eID="c56-0060__main__d2e12806"/>she was taught <lb n="c56-0060__main__25"/> all the duties of servant & was very <lb n="c56-0060__main__26"/> kindly treated. I dare say that you now <lb n="c56-0060__main__27"/> remember all about it, for Justine <lb n="c56-0060__main__28"/> was a great favourite of yours, & I <lb n="c56-0060__main__29"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0060__main__d2e12827"/>remember<del eID="c56-0060__main__d2e12827"/>recollect you once said, that<lb n="c56-0061__main__1"/> if you were <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12845"/>a<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12845"/> in an ill humour <lb n="c56-0061__main__2"/> one glance from Justine, could dissi<lb n="c56-0061__main__3"/>pate it <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12859"/>from<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12859"/>for the same reason <lb n="c56-0061__main__4"/> that Ariosto gave concerning the <lb n="c56-0061__main__5"/> beauty of Angelica:– she looked so <lb n="c56-0061__main__6"/> frank hearted and happy. My Aunt <lb n="c56-0061__main__7"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12875"/>was very fond of her which<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12875"/><del next="#c56-0061.05" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12878"/>caused<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12878"/>concieved an attachment for her, by which she <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>wasinduced<lb n="c56-0061__main__8"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12901" xml:id="c56-0061.05"/>her to<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12901"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>to give her an<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12919"/>d<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12919"/> education <lb n="c56-0061__main__9"/> superior to that which she <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>had at <lb n="c56-0061__main__10"/> first intended.<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12944"/>and she<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12944"/>This benefit was fully <lb n="c56-0061__main__11"/> repaid; <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12953"/>for<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12953"/> Justine was the most <lb n="c56-0061__main__12"/> grateful little creature in the <lb n="c56-0061__main__13"/> world. I do not mean that she <lb n="c56-0061__main__14"/> made any professions–I never <lb n="c56-0061__main__15"/> heard one pass her lips <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12965"/>w<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12965"/> but <lb n="c56-0061__main__16"/> you could see by her eye that <lb n="c56-0061__main__17"/> she almost adored her protectress. <lb n="c56-0061__main__18"/> Although very gay, and in many respects <lb n="c56-0061__main__19"/> inconsiderate, yet she paid the greatest <lb n="c56-0061__main__20"/> attention to every gesture of my Aunt– <lb n="c56-0061__main__21"/> she thought her the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12983"/>miracle<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12983"/>model of all<lb n="c56-0061__main__22"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e12995"/>perfection<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e12995"/>excellence, and endeavoured to imi<lb n="c56-0061__main__23"/>tate her words and even her man<lb n="c56-0061__main__24"/>ners, so that <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>even now she <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e13029"/>very<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e13029"/> often <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e13034"/>puts<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e13034"/><lb n="c56-0061__left_margin__1"/>reminds<lb n="c56-0061__main__25"/> me <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e13050"/>in mind<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e13050"/> of her. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0061__main__d2e13055"/>You did not<del eID="c56-0061__main__d2e13055"/> observe <lb n="c56-0061__main__26"/> all this, nor did I at the time but <lb n="c56-0061__main__27"/> it struck me afterwards when I <lb n="c56-0061__main__28"/> reflected on the subject.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0061__main__29"/> When my dearest Aunt died every <lb n="c56-0061__main__30"/> one was too much occupied in their<lb n="c56-0062__main__1"/> own <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0062__main__d2e13083"/>grif<del eID="c56-0062__main__d2e13083"/> grief to notice poor Justine <lb n="c56-0062__main__2"/> who had attended her during her <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0062__main__d2e13088"/>whole<del eID="c56-0062__main__d2e13088"/><lb n="c56-0062__main__3"/> illness with the greatest affection. <lb n="c56-0062__main__4"/> Poor Justine was very ill but other <lb n="c56-0062__main__5"/> tryals were reserved for her.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0062__main__6"/> One by one her brothers & sister <lb n="c56-0062__main__7"/> had died and her mother was now <lb n="c56-0062__main__8"/> with the exception of her neglected <lb n="c56-0062__main__9"/> daugher <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0062__main__d2e13109"/>was<del eID="c56-0062__main__d2e13109"/> left childless. The <lb n="c56-0062__main__10"/> conscience of the woman was troubled <lb n="c56-0062__main__11"/> and she began to think that the <lb n="c56-0062__main__12"/> deaths of her favourites was a judgement <lb n="c56-0062__main__13"/>sentfrom heaven to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0062__main__d2e13126"/>punish<del eID="c56-0062__main__d2e13126"/>chastise her partialli<mdel>n</mdel>ty <lb n="c56-0062__main__14"/> she was a roman Catholic and I believe <lb n="c56-0062__main__15"/> her confessor encouraged the idea<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>which she had concieved.. Accor<lb n="c56-0062__main__16"/>dingly, a few Months after your depar<lb n="c56-0062__main__17"/>ture for <mdel>i</mdel>Ingolstadt, <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0062__main__d2e13181"/>sh<del eID="c56-0062__main__d2e13181"/> Justine was called <lb n="c56-0062__main__18"/> home by her repentant Mother. Poor <lb n="c56-0062__main__19"/> girl she wept when she quitted our house <lb n="c56-0062__main__20"/> she was much altered since the death <lb n="c56-0062__main__21"/> of my aunt: grief had given soft<mdel>e</mdel>ness <lb n="c56-0062__main__22"/> and a winning mildness to her manners <lb n="c56-0062__main__23"/> which had before been remarkable <lb n="c56-0062__main__24"/> for vivacity. Nor <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0062__main__d2e13208"/>did<del eID="c56-0062__main__d2e13208"/> was her residence <lb n="c56-0062__main__25"/> at her Mothers house of a nature to <lb n="c56-0062__main__26"/> restore her gaiety. The poor <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0062__main__d2e13216"/>fo<del eID="c56-0062__main__d2e13216"/> wo <lb n="c56-0062__main__27"/> man was very vacillating in her <lb n="c56-0062__main__28"/> repentance. She sometimes begged <lb n="c56-0062__main__29"/> Justine to forgive her unkindness<lb n="c56-0063__main__1"/> but much oftenor accused her <lb n="c56-0063__main__2"/> as having caused the deaths of <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13237"/>h<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13237"/> her <lb n="c56-0063__main__3"/> brothers & sister. Perpetual fretting <lb n="c56-0063__main__4"/> at last threw Mad. Martin into <lb n="c56-0063__main__5"/> a decline, which at first encreased <lb n="c56-0063__main__6"/> her irritability, but she is now at <lb n="c56-0063__main__7"/> rest for ever; <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13254"/>for<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13254"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13257"/>S<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13257"/> she <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13264"/>did<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13264"/> died <lb n="c56-0063__main__8"/> on the first approach of cold at <lb n="c56-0063__main__9"/> the beginning of th<mdel>e</mdel>is<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>last winter that <lb n="c56-0063__main__10"/> has just passed. Justine has <lb n="c56-0063__main__11"/> returned to us and I assure you <lb n="c56-0063__main__12"/> I love her tenderly. She is very clever <lb n="c56-0063__main__13"/> and extremely mild & pretty and as <lb n="c56-0063__main__14"/> I mentioned before <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13308"/>she<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13308"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13311"/>is<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13311"/> her <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13316"/>air<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13316"/>mein and <lb n="c56-0063__main__15"/><lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__1"/>her expressions <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13336"/>are<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13336"/> continually remind me <lb n="c56-0063__main__16"/> of my dear Aunt.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0063__main__17"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13345"/>And<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13345"/> I must say a few words to <lb n="c56-0063__main__18"/> you also, My dear Victor, of little darling <lb n="c56-0063__main__19"/> William. I wish you could see him. He <lb n="c56-0063__main__20"/> is very tall of his age with sweet laughing <lb n="c56-0063__main__21"/> blue eyes <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13357"/>and<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13357"/> dark eyelashes and curling <lb n="c56-0063__main__22"/> hair When he smiles two little dimples <lb n="c56-0063__main__23"/> appear on his cheeks which are rosy <lb n="c56-0063__main__24"/> with health — his chin comes down in <lb n="c56-0063__main__25"/> a beautiful oval <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13369"/>a<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13369"/> After this descrip<lb n="c56-0063__main__26"/>tion I can only say what our visitors <lb n="c56-0063__main__27"/> say a thousand times a day–'He is too <lb n="c56-0063__main__28"/> pretty for a boy'.<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0063.03">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__1"/> He has already <lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__2"/> had one or two <lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__3"/> little <shi rend="underline">wives</shi><lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__4"/> but Louisa <lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__5"/><mdel>M</mdel><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__left_margin__d2e13411"/>Caln<del eID="c56-0063__left_margin__d2e13411"/> Biron <lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__6"/>is his favourite– <lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__7"/> a pretty little <lb n="c56-0063__left_margin__8"/> girl of five years old <mdel>to</mdel><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0063__main__29"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0063__main__d2e13439"/>Miss Mansfeld<del eID="c56-0063__main__d2e13439"/> Now, dear Victor I dare<lb n="c56-0064__main__1"/> say <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13452"/>I<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13452"/> you wish to be indulged in a little <lb n="c56-0064__main__2"/> gossip about your acquaintance. The <lb n="c56-0064__main__3"/> pretty Miss Mansfeld has already received <lb n="c56-0064__main__4"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13462"/>on<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13462"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13465"/>her<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13465"/> the congratulatory visits on her <lb n="c56-0064__main__5"/> approaching marriage with a young <lb n="c56-0064__main__6"/> Englishman, John <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13472"/>Mebourne<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13472"/>Mel<lb n="c56-0064__main__7"/>bourne Esq. Her ugly sister Manon <lb n="c56-0064__main__8"/> married M. Hofland the rich banker last <lb n="c56-0064__main__9"/> autumn. Your favourite schoolfellow <lb n="c56-0064__main__10"/> Louis Manoir <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13488"/>ma<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13488"/> has suffered several <lb n="c56-0064__main__11"/> misfortunes <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13494"/>d<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13494"/> since the departure <lb n="c56-0064__main__12"/> of Clerval from Geneva <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13499"/>b<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13499"/> But he <lb n="c56-0064__main__13"/> has <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13504"/>atready<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13504"/> already recovered his spirits <lb n="c56-0064__main__14"/> and he reported to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13510"/>m<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13510"/> be on the point <lb n="c56-0064__main__15"/> of marrying a very lively pretty french <lb n="c56-0064__main__16"/> woman— Mad. Tavernier –She is a widow <lb n="c56-0064__main__17"/> and much older than Manoir but <lb n="c56-0064__main__18"/> she is much <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13522"/>adv<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13522"/> admired and a <lb n="c56-0064__main__19"/> favourite with every body.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0064__main__20"/> I have written myself into good spi<lb n="c56-0064__main__21"/>rits, dear Cousin yet I can not conclude <lb n="c56-0064__main__22"/> without again anxiously enquiring <lb n="c56-0064__main__23"/> concerning your health— Dear Victor, if <lb n="c56-0064__main__24"/> you are not very ill write yourself <lb n="c56-0064__main__25"/> and make your father and all <lb n="c56-0064__main__26"/> of us happy or— I cannot bear to <lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__1"/> think <mdel>of</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>on the <lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__2"/> other side <lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__3"/> of the question <lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__4"/> my tears al<lb n="c56-0064__left_margin__5"/>ready flow<lb n="c56-0064__main__27"/> Your very affectionate Cousin <lb n="c56-0064__main__28"/><milestone next="#c56-0064.04" spanTo="#c56-0064.03" unit="tei:seg"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0064__main__d2e13594"/>dearrest<del eID="c56-0064__main__d2e13594"/> – dearest Victor<metamark function="separate">)</metamark> Elizabeth Lavenza <lb n="c56-0064__main__29"/><milestone spanTo="#c56-0064.05" unit="tei:seg" xml:id="c56-0064.04"/>write–
